cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast through Saturday, then turning slowly west toward the central-upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: mid-Texas coast near Port O’Connor/Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.impacted_coast: entire Texas coast from Brownsville northward to the Louisiana border and southwestern Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Monday night through Tuesday as the system edges north of the mid-Texas coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along the upper Texas coast and Sabine Lake including Port Arthur’s waterfront during prolonged onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Slow movement could bring 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals, producing freshwater flooding around the port and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning this weekend; minor coastal flooding possible at high tide.
